faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course covers: software engineering paradigms, project management, system and requirements analysis, design, implementaton, testing, quality management and control.
description.et: Tarkvaratehnika paradigmad, projekti juhtimine, ülesande ja tarkvara nõuete analüüs, tarkvara kavandamine, realiseerimine, testimine, kvaliteedi juhtimine ja kontroll.

objectives.en: To obtain basic knowledge in software engineering and primary skills for working at any stage of software development projects.
objectives.et: Omandatakse tarkvaratehnika alased algteadmised ja esmane oskus tööks tarkvaraprojekti põhietappides. Vastavad teadmised on hädavajalikud osalmisel tarkvaraprojektides.

independent_work.et: See Grading section of course web site

description.et:
The Practical Assessment will be obtained as follows:
    * 10 points per lab session. Total = 70 points. (converted to 60% of grade) See below for details on how the lab sessions are graded.
    * Lab tasks have to be done in groups of 4 students. 
    * A detailed description of the lab tasks as well as the schedule and assessment rules is provided in the course wiki.

If you get less than 33% of the total marks in the practical assessment, you will get a grade of 'F' in your first examination. In this case, you will be given a second chance to improve your practical assessment score. If your score after the second try is at least 20 out of 60, you will become eligible for a resit (kordueksam).
Conceptual Assessment

The exam is worth 30 points. Students who get less than 10 out of 30 in this exam, will get a grade of 'F', regardless of their Practical Assignment score. This same rule will apply for the resit (kordueksam).

The scores of the Practical Assignments (60%), Quizzes (10%) and and the Exam (30%) will be added. This cumulated score will be translated into a grade between A and F according to the standard university scale:
    * A: >90 .. 100
    * B: >80 .. 90
    * C: >70 .. 80
    * D: >60 .. 70
    * E: >50 .. 60
    * F: 0 .. 50

grade_evaluation.et:
The final result consists of:
- a completed project conducted during the labs (practice sessions) - 60% of total grade
- Quizzes 10% of total grade
- a final exam - 30% of total grade

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
Week 01: Lecture 01 - Introduction to Software Engineering   
Week 02: Lecture 02 - Requirements Engineering - I     
Week 03: Lecture 03 - Requirements Engineering - II    
Week 04: Lecture 04 - Analysis               
Week 05: Lecture 05 - Development Infrastructure           
Week 06: Lecture 06 - Continuous Development & Integration  
Week 07: Lecture 07 - Project Estimation / Architecture and Design I  
Week 08: Lecture 08 - Architecture and Design II               
Week 09: Lecture 09 - Verification and Validation (Testing) I         
Week 10: Lecture 10 - Verification and Validation (Testing) II        
Week 11: Lecture 11 - Refactoring (and TDD)                    
Week 12: Lecture 12 - Agile/Lean Methods I                 
Week 13: Lecture 13 -  Course wrap-up, review, and exam preparation

*	Week 01: -- (no labs)
*	Weeks 02-04: Requirements gathering
*	Weeks 04-06: Requirements Specification, Modeling, Planning
*	Weeks 06-08: Development Environment
*	Weeks 08-10: Development - I
*	Weeks 10-12: Development - II
*	Weeks 12-14: Automatic unit test, refactoring & functional test planning
*	Weeks 14-16: Functional and non-functional testing
